meanings.definition: A net used to catch fish or other aquatic animals.
meanings.sent1: The fisherman cast his dragnet into the river to catch some fish.
meanings.sent2: The dragnet was full of various sea creatures when it was pulled out of the water.
meanings.sent3: The clever octopus managed to escape the dragnet by squeezing through a small hole.
meanings.sent4: The dragnet of the ocean captured a colorful array of marine life.
meanings.sent5: The dragnet slowly descended into the water, ready to ensnare its prey.

meanings.definition: A system of coordinated measures for apprehending criminals or suspects.
meanings.sent1: The police set up a dragnet to catch the thief who had been stealing from the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The dragnet of law enforcement caught several suspects involved in the robbery.
meanings.sent3: The dragnet operation was so successful that even the most elusive criminals were captured.
meanings.sent4: The dragnet of justice swept through the city, bringing criminals to justice.
meanings.sent5: The dragnet of the law closed in on the fugitive, leading to his capture.
